Author: Justin Cormack <justin.cormack@docker.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test-unit test-integration-cli test-docker-py
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Justin Cormack <justin.cormack@docker.com>
Comment: # See also "hack/make/.ensure-frozen-images" (which needs to be updated any time this list is)

Author: Justin Cormack <justin.cormack@docker.com>
Comment:
# Install tomlv, runc, containerd, grimes, docker-proxy
# Please edit hack/dockerfile/install-binaries.sh to update them.

Author: Guillaume J. Charmes <guillaume.charmes@docker.com>
Comment:
# VERSION:        0.4
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Testing docker PRs and commits on top of master using
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of
#                 Docker in Docker made by Jerome Petazzoni.
#                 https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   This Dockerfile adapts /Dockerfile to enable docker PRs and commits testing
#   Optional arguments:
#       [commit]  (default: 'HEAD')
#       [repo]    (default: 'http://github.com/dotcloud/docker')
#       [branch]  (default: 'master')
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t test_docker .
# TO_RUN:         docker run -privileged test_docker hack/dind test_docker.sh [commit] [repo] [branch]

Author: Guillaume J. Charmes <guillaume.charmes@docker.com>

#
# # Run the test suite:

Author: Guillaume J. Charmes <guillaume.charmes@docker.com>
Comment:
# VERSION:        1.6
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Build docker nightly release using Docker in Docker.
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of docker in docker
#                 made by Jerome Petazzoni.  https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   release_credentials.json is a base64 json encoded file containing:
#       { "AWS_ACCESS_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_id",
#         "AWS_SECRET_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_key",
#         "GPG_PASSPHRASE": "Test_docker_GPG_passphrase_signature" }
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t dockerbuilder .
# TO_RELEASE:     docker run -i -t -privileged -e AWS_S3_BUCKET="test.docker.io" dockerbuilder hack/dind dockerbuild.sh

# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test-unit test-integration-cli test-docker-py
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Victor Vieux <victor.vieux@docker.com>
Comment:
# VERSION:        1.6
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Build docker nightly release using Docker in Docker.
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of docker in docker
#                 made by Jerome Petazzoni.  https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   release_credentials.json is a base64 json encoded file containing:
#       { "AWS_ACCESS_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_id",
#         "AWS_SECRET_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_key",
#         "GPG_PASSPHRASE": "Test_docker_GPG_passphrase_signature" }
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t dockerbuilder .
# TO_RELEASE:     docker run -i -t -privileged -e AWS_S3_BUCKET="test.docker.io" dockerbuilder hack/dind dockerbuild.sh

Author: Victor Vieux <victor.vieux@docker.com>
Comment:
# VERSION:        0.4
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Testing docker PRs and commits on top of master using
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of
#                 Docker in Docker made by Jerome Petazzoni.
#                 https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   This Dockerfile adapts /Dockerfile to enable docker PRs and commits testing
#   Optional arguments:
#       [commit]  (default: 'HEAD')
#       [repo]    (default: 'http://github.com/dotcloud/docker')
#       [branch]  (default: 'master')
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t test_docker .
# TO_RUN:         docker run -privileged test_docker hack/dind test_docker.sh [commit] [repo] [branch]

Author: Michael Crosby <michael@docker.com>
Comment:
# VERSION:        0.4
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Testing docker PRs and commits on top of master using
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of
#                 Docker in Docker made by Jerome Petazzoni.
#                 https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   This Dockerfile adapts /Dockerfile to enable docker PRs and commits testing
#   Optional arguments:
#       [commit]  (default: 'HEAD')
#       [repo]    (default: 'http://github.com/dotcloud/docker')
#       [branch]  (default: 'master')
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t test_docker .
# TO_RUN:         docker run -privileged test_docker hack/dind test_docker.sh [commit] [repo] [branch]

Author: Michael Crosby <michael@docker.com>
Comment:
# VERSION:        1.6
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Build docker nightly release using Docker in Docker.
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of docker in docker
#                 made by Jerome Petazzoni.  https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   release_credentials.json is a base64 json encoded file containing:
#       { "AWS_ACCESS_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_id",
#         "AWS_SECRET_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_key",
#         "GPG_PASSPHRASE": "Test_docker_GPG_passphrase_signature" }
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t dockerbuilder .
# TO_RELEASE:     docker run -i -t -privileged -e AWS_S3_BUCKET="test.docker.io" dockerbuilder hack/dind dockerbuild.sh

# # Run tests e.g. integration, py
# # hack/make.sh binary test-integration test-docker-py
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -privileged docker hack/make.sh test

Comment:
# VERSION:        0.3
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.3
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@dotcloud.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Testing docker PRs and commits on top of master using
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of
#                 Docker in Docker made by Jerome Petazzoni.
#                 https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   This Dockerfile adapts /Dockerfile to enable docker PRs and commits testing
#   Optional arguments:
#       [commit]  (default: 'HEAD')
#       [repo]    (default: 'http://github.com/dotcloud/docker')
#       [branch]  (default: 'master')
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t test_docker .
# TO_RUN:         docker run -privileged test_docker hack/dind test_docker.sh [commit] [repo] [branch]

# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker

# # Apparmor messes with privileged mode: disable it
# /etc/init.d/apparmor stop ; /etc/init.d/apparmor teardown
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/dotcloud/docker -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined -i -t docker bash
#
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined docker go test -v
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined \
# -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
# -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
# -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
# -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
# -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined -privileged docker hack/release.sh
#

Author: Victor Vieux <victor.vieux@docker.com>
Comment:
# VERSION:        1.6
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Build docker nightly release using Docker in Docker.
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of docker in docker
#                 made by Jerome Petazzoni.  https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   release_credentials.json is a base64 json encoded file containing:
#       { "AWS_ACCESS_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_id",
#         "AWS_SECRET_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_key",
#         "GPG_PASSPHRASE": "Test_docker_GPG_passphrase_signature" }
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t dockerbuilder .
# TO_RELEASE:     docker run -i -t -privileged -e AWS_S3_BUCKET="test.docker.io" dockerbuilder hack/dind dockerbuild.sh

Author: Victor Vieux <victor.vieux@docker.com>
Comment:
# VERSION:        0.4
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Testing docker PRs and commits on top of master using
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of
#                 Docker in Docker made by Jerome Petazzoni.
#                 https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   This Dockerfile adapts /Dockerfile to enable docker PRs and commits testing
#   Optional arguments:
#       [commit]  (default: 'HEAD')
#       [repo]    (default: 'http://github.com/dotcloud/docker')
#       [branch]  (default: 'master')
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t test_docker .
# TO_RUN:         docker run -privileged test_docker hack/dind test_docker.sh [commit] [repo] [branch]

# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker

#

# # Apparmor messes with privileged mode: disable it

#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/dotcloud/docker -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined -i -t docker bash
#
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined docker go test -v
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined \
# -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
# -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
# -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
# -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
# -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined -privileged docker hack/release.sh
#

Author: Alexander Morozov <lk4d4@docker.com>
Comment:
# !!! TEMPORARY HACK !!!
# Because of https://github.com/golang/go/issues/15286 we have to revert to Go 1.5.3 for windows/amd64 in master
# To change which version of Go to compile with, simply prepend PATH with /usr/local/go1.5.3/bin
# and set GOROOT to /usr/local/go1.5.3

Author: Alexander Morozov <lk4d4@docker.com>
Comment: # see also "hack/make/.ensure-frozen-images" (which needs to be updated any time this list is)

Author: Riyaz Faizullabhoy <riyaz.faizullabhoy@docker.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Riyaz Faizullabhoy <riyaz.faizullabhoy@docker.com>
Comment: # see also "hack/make/.ensure-frozen-images" (which needs to be updated any time this list is)

Author: Sebastiaan van Stijn <github@gone.nl>
Comment:
# # Make a dockerd binary.
# # hack/make.sh binary
#
# # Install dockerd to /usr/local/bin
# # make install
#
# # Run unit tests
# # hack/test/unit
#
# # Run tests e.g. integration, py
# # hack/make.sh binary test-integration test-docker-py
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \

Comment:
# VERSION:        0.4
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Testing docker PRs and commits on top of master using
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of
#                 Docker in Docker made by Jerome Petazzoni.
#                 https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   This Dockerfile adapts /Dockerfile to enable docker PRs and commits testing
#   Optional arguments:
#       [commit]  (default: 'HEAD')
#       [repo]    (default: 'http://github.com/dotcloud/docker')
#       [branch]  (default: 'master')
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t test_docker .
# TO_RUN:         docker run -privileged test_docker hack/dind test_docker.sh [commit] [repo] [branch]

Author: Guillaume J. Charmes <guillaume.charmes@docker.com>
Comment:
# VERSION:        1.6
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Build docker nightly release using Docker in Docker.
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of docker in docker
#                 made by Jerome Petazzoni.  https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   release_credentials.json is a base64 json encoded file containing:
#       { "AWS_ACCESS_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_id",
#         "AWS_SECRET_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_key",
#         "GPG_PASSPHRASE": "Test_docker_GPG_passphrase_signature" }
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t dockerbuilder .
# TO_RELEASE:     docker run -i -t -privileged -e AWS_S3_BUCKET="test.docker.io" dockerbuilder hack/dind dockerbuild.sh

Author: Cristian Staretu <cristian.staretu@gmail.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: Apparmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Cristian Staretu <cristian.staretu@gmail.com>
Comment: # TODO replace FPM with some very minimal debhelper stuff

Author: Michael Crosby <michael@docker.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
# # Apparmor messes with privileged mode: disable it
# /etc/init.d/apparmor stop ; /etc/init.d/apparmor teardown
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/dotcloud/docker -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined -i -t docker bash
#
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#

Author: Victor Vieux <victor.vieux@docker.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
# # Apparmor messes with privileged mode: disable it
# /etc/init.d/apparmor stop ; /etc/init.d/apparmor teardown
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/dotcloud/docker -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined -i -t docker bash
#
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined docker go test -v
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#

#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test

# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: Apparmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Sebastiaan van Stijn <github@gone.nl>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: Apparmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Comment:
# VERSION:        1.5
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.4
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@dotcloud.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Build docker nightly release using Docker in Docker.
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of docker in docker
#                 made by Jerome Petazzoni.  https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   release_credentials.json is a base64 json encoded file containing:
#       { "AWS_ACCESS_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_id",
#         "AWS_SECRET_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_key",
#         "GPG_PASSPHRASE": "Test_docker_GPG_passphrase_signature" }
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t dockerbuilder .
# TO_RELEASE:     docker run -i -t -privileged -e AWS_S3_BUCKET="test.docker.io" dockerbuilder hack/dind dockerbuild.sh

Author: Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel.mizyrycki@dotcloud.com>
Comment:
# VERSION:        1.6
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Build docker nightly release using Docker in Docker.
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of docker in docker
#                 made by Jerome Petazzoni.  https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   release_credentials.json is a base64 json encoded file containing:
#       { "AWS_ACCESS_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_id",
#         "AWS_SECRET_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_key",
#         "GPG_PASSPHRASE": "Test_docker_GPG_passphrase_signature" }
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t dockerbuilder .
# TO_RELEASE:     docker run -i -t -privileged -e AWS_S3_BUCKET="test.docker.io" dockerbuilder hack/dind dockerbuild.sh

Author: Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel.mizyrycki@dotcloud.com>
Comment:
# VERSION:        0.4
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Testing docker PRs and commits on top of master using
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of
#                 Docker in Docker made by Jerome Petazzoni.
#                 https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   This Dockerfile adapts /Dockerfile to enable docker PRs and commits testing
#   Optional arguments:
#       [commit]  (default: 'HEAD')
#       [repo]    (default: 'http://github.com/dotcloud/docker')
#       [branch]  (default: 'master')
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t test_docker .
# TO_RUN:         docker run -privileged test_docker hack/dind test_docker.sh [commit] [repo] [branch]

Author: Tianon Gravi <admwiggin@gmail.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: Apparmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Tianon Gravi <admwiggin@gmail.com>
Comment: # TODO replace FPM with some very minimal debhelper stuff

Author: Guillaume J. Charmes <guillaume.charmes@docker.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
# # Apparmor messes with privileged mode: disable it
# /etc/init.d/apparmor stop ; /etc/init.d/apparmor teardown
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/dotcloud/docker -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined -i -t docker bash
#
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#

Author: Tibor Vass <teabee89@gmail.com>
Comment:
# # Make a dockerd binary.
# # hack/make.sh binary
#
# # Install dockerd to /usr/local/bin
# # make install
#
# # Run unit tests
# # hack/test/unit
#
# # Run tests e.g. integration, py
# # hack/make.sh binary test-integration test-docker-py
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Tibor Vass <teabee89@gmail.com>

# FIXME(vdemeester) this is kept for other script depending on it to not fail right away

Author: Ying Li <ying.li@docker.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Ying Li <ying.li@docker.com>
Comment: # see also "hack/make/.ensure-frozen-images" (which needs to be updated any time this list is)

Author: Andy Rothfusz <github@developersupport.net>
Comment:
# VERSION:        1.6
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Build docker nightly release using Docker in Docker.
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of docker in docker
#                 made by Jerome Petazzoni.  https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   release_credentials.json is a base64 json encoded file containing:
#       { "AWS_ACCESS_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_id",
#         "AWS_SECRET_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_key",
#         "GPG_PASSPHRASE": "Test_docker_GPG_passphrase_signature" }
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t dockerbuilder .
# TO_RELEASE:     docker run -i -t -privileged -e AWS_S3_BUCKET="test.docker.io" dockerbuilder hack/dind dockerbuild.sh

Author: Andy Rothfusz <github@developersupport.net>
Comment:
# VERSION:        0.4
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Testing docker PRs and commits on top of master using
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of
#                 Docker in Docker made by Jerome Petazzoni.
#                 https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   This Dockerfile adapts /Dockerfile to enable docker PRs and commits testing
#   Optional arguments:
#       [commit]  (default: 'HEAD')
#       [repo]    (default: 'http://github.com/dotcloud/docker')
#       [branch]  (default: 'master')
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t test_docker .
# TO_RUN:         docker run -privileged test_docker hack/dind test_docker.sh [commit] [repo] [branch]

Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
# # Apparmor messes with privileged mode: disable it
# /etc/init.d/apparmor stop ; /etc/init.d/apparmor teardown
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/dotcloud/docker -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined -i -t docker bash
#
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#

Author: Zilin Du <zilin.du@gmail.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
# # Apparmor messes with privileged mode: disable it
# /etc/init.d/apparmor stop ; /etc/init.d/apparmor teardown
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/dotcloud/docker -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined -i -t docker bash
#
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#

Author: Zilin Du <zilin.du@gmail.com>
Comment:
# VERSION:        0.3
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.3
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@dotcloud.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Testing docker PRs and commits on top of master using
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of
#                 Docker in Docker made by Jerome Petazzoni.
#                 https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   This Dockerfile adapts /Dockerfile to enable docker PRs and commits testing
#   Optional arguments:
#       [commit]  (default: 'HEAD')
#       [repo]    (default: 'http://github.com/dotcloud/docker')
#       [branch]  (default: 'master')
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t test_docker .
# TO_RUN:         docker run -privileged test_docker hack/dind test_docker.sh [commit] [repo] [branch]

Author: Alexander Morozov <lk4d4@docker.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test-unit test-integration-cli test-docker-py
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Alexander Morozov <lk4d4@docker.com>
Comment: # See also "hack/make/.ensure-frozen-images" (which needs to be updated any time this list is)

Author: Alexander Morozov <lk4d4@docker.com>
Comment:
# Install tomlv, runc, containerd, grimes, docker-proxy
# Please edit hack/dockerfile/install-binaries.sh to update them.

# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test-unit test-integration-cli test-docker-py
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Tibor Vass <teabee89@gmail.com>
Comment: # see also "hack/make/.ensure-frozen-images" (which needs to be updated any time this list is)

Author: Michael Crosby <michael@docker.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/dotcloud/docker -privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -privileged docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run -privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: Apparmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Michael Crosby <michael@docker.com>
Comment: # TODO replace FPM with some very minimal debhelper stuff

# # Run tests e.g. integration, py
# # hack/make.sh binary test-integration test-docker-py
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test-unit test-integration-cli test-docker-py
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Cristian Staretu <cristian.staretu@gmail.com>
Comment: # See also "hack/make/.ensure-frozen-images" (which needs to be updated any time this list is)

Comment:
# VERSION:        0.3
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.3
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@dotcloud.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Testing docker PRs and commits on top of master using
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of
#                 Docker in Docker made by Jerome Petazzoni.
#                 https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   This Dockerfile adapts /Dockerfile to enable docker PRs and commits testing
#   Optional arguments:
#       [commit]  (default: 'HEAD')
#       [repo]    (default: 'http://github.com/dotcloud/docker')
#       [branch]  (default: 'master')
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t test_docker .
# TO_RUN:         docker run -privileged test_docker hack/dind test_docker.sh [commit] [repo] [branch]

Author: Tianon Gravi <admwiggin@gmail.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
# # Apparmor messes with privileged mode: disable it
# /etc/init.d/apparmor stop ; /etc/init.d/apparmor teardown
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/dotcloud/docker -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined -i -t docker bash
#
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#

Author: Arnaud Porterie <arnaud.porterie@docker.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Arnaud Porterie <arnaud.porterie@docker.com>
Comment: # see also "hack/make/.ensure-frozen-images" (which needs to be updated any time this list is)

Author: Mrunal Patel <mrunalp@gmail.com>

Author: Mrunal Patel <mrunalp@gmail.com>
Comment:
# !!! TEMPORARY HACK !!!
# Because of https://github.com/golang/go/issues/15286 we have to revert to Go 1.5.3 for windows/amd64 in master
# To change which version of Go to compile with, simply prepend PATH with /usr/local/go1.5.3/bin
# and set GOROOT to /usr/local/go1.5.3

Author: Mrunal Patel <mrunalp@gmail.com>
Comment: # see also "hack/make/.ensure-frozen-images" (which needs to be updated any time this list is)

Author: Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel.mizyrycki@dotcloud.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
# # Apparmor messes with privileged mode: disable it
# /etc/init.d/apparmor stop ; /etc/init.d/apparmor teardown
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/dotcloud/docker -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined -i -t docker bash
#
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined docker go test -v
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined \
# -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
# -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
# -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
# -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
# -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined -privileged docker hack/release.sh
#

Author: Sebastiaan van Stijn <github@gone.nl>
Comment:
# # Make a dockerd binary.
# # hack/make.sh binary
#
# # Install dockerd to /usr/local/bin
# # make install
#
# # Run unit tests
# # hack/test/unit
#
# # Run tests e.g. integration, py
# # hack/make.sh binary test-integration test-docker-py
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Sebastiaan van Stijn <github@gone.nl>
Comment:
# FIXME(vdemeester) this is kept for other script depending on it to not fail right away
# Remove this once the other scripts uses something else to detect the version

Comment: # Just a little hack so we don't have to install these deps twice, once for runc and once for dockerd

Author: Arnaud Porterie <arnaud.porterie@docker.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Arnaud Porterie <arnaud.porterie@docker.com>
Comment: # see also "hack/make/.ensure-frozen-images" (which needs to be updated any time this list is)

# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.

Author: Victor Vieux <victor.vieux@docker.com>
Comment:
# VERSION:        0.3
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.3
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@dotcloud.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Testing docker PRs and commits on top of master using
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of
#                 Docker in Docker made by Jerome Petazzoni.
#                 https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   This Dockerfile adapts /Dockerfile to enable docker PRs and commits testing
#   Optional arguments:
#       [commit]  (default: 'HEAD')
#       [repo]    (default: 'http://github.com/dotcloud/docker')
#       [branch]  (default: 'master')
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t test_docker .
# TO_RUN:         docker run -privileged test_docker hack/dind test_docker.sh [commit] [repo] [branch]

Author: Sebastiaan van Stijn <github@gone.nl>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -e DOCKER_GITCOMMIT=foo --privileged docker hack/make.sh test-unit test-integration-cli test-docker-py
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Sebastiaan van Stijn <github@gone.nl>
Comment:
# Install tomlv, vndr, runc, containerd, tini, docker-proxy dockercli
# Please edit hack/dockerfile/install-binaries.sh to update them.

# VERSION:        1.5
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.4
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@dotcloud.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Build docker nightly release using Docker in Docker.
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of docker in docker
#                 made by Jerome Petazzoni.  https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   release_credentials.json is a base64 json encoded file containing:
#       { "AWS_ACCESS_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_id",
#         "AWS_SECRET_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_key",
#         "GPG_PASSPHRASE": "Test_docker_GPG_passphrase_signature" }
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t dockerbuilder .
# TO_RELEASE:     docker run -i -t -privileged -e AWS_S3_BUCKET="test.docker.io" dockerbuilder hack/dind dockerbuild.sh

Author: Alexander Morozov <lk4d4@docker.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
# # Apparmor messes with privileged mode: disable it
# /etc/init.d/apparmor stop ; /etc/init.d/apparmor teardown
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/dotcloud/docker -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined -i -t docker bash
#
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run -privileged -lxc-conf=lxc.aa_profile=unconfined \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#

# VERSION:        1.6
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Build docker nightly release using Docker in Docker.
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of docker in docker
#                 made by Jerome Petazzoni.  https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   release_credentials.json is a base64 json encoded file containing:
#       { "AWS_ACCESS_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_id",
#         "AWS_SECRET_KEY": "Test_docker_AWS_S3_bucket_key",
#         "GPG_PASSPHRASE": "Test_docker_GPG_passphrase_signature" }
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t dockerbuilder .
# TO_RELEASE:     docker run -i -t -privileged -e AWS_S3_BUCKET="test.docker.io" dockerbuilder hack/dind dockerbuild.sh

Author: Victor Vieux <victor.vieux@docker.com>
Comment:
# VERSION:        0.4
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.6
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@docker.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Testing docker PRs and commits on top of master using
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of
#                 Docker in Docker made by Jerome Petazzoni.
#                 https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   This Dockerfile adapts /Dockerfile to enable docker PRs and commits testing
#   Optional arguments:
#       [commit]  (default: 'HEAD')
#       [repo]    (default: 'http://github.com/dotcloud/docker')
#       [branch]  (default: 'master')
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t test_docker .
# TO_RUN:         docker run -privileged test_docker hack/dind test_docker.sh [commit] [repo] [branch]

#

Author: Phil Estes <estesp@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Phil Estes <estesp@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Comment: # TODO replace FPM with some very minimal debhelper stuff

Author: Phil Estes <estesp@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Comment: # see also "hack/make/.ensure-frozen-images" (which needs to be updated any time this list is)

# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test-unit test-integration-cli test-docker-py
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh

# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Comment: # See also "hack/make/.ensure-frozen-images" (which needs to be updated any time this list is)

# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -e DOCKER_GITCOMMIT=foo --privileged docker hack/make.sh test-unit test-integration test-docker-py
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Vincent Demeester <vincent.demeester@docker.com>
Comment: # TODO: when issue #35963 fixed, we can upgrade the busybox to multi-arch

Author: Vincent Demeester <vincent.demeester@docker.com>
Comment:

Comment:
# VERSION:        0.3
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.3
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@dotcloud.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Testing docker PRs and commits on top of master using
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of
#                 Docker in Docker made by Jerome Petazzoni.
#                 https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   This Dockerfile adapts /Dockerfile to enable docker PRs and commits testing
#   Optional arguments:
#       [commit]  (default: 'HEAD')
#       [repo]    (default: 'http://github.com/dotcloud/docker')
#       [branch]  (default: 'master')
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t test_docker .
# TO_RUN:         docker run -privileged test_docker hack/dind test_docker.sh [commit] [repo] [branch]

Author: Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel.mizyrycki@dotcloud.com>
Comment: #### FIXME. Temporarily install docker and dind with proper apparmor handling

# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker

#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/docker/docker --privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run --privileged docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: Apparmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Comment:
# VERSION:        0.3
# DOCKER-VERSION  0.6.3
# AUTHOR:         Daniel Mizyrycki <daniel@dotcloud.com>
# DESCRIPTION:    Testing docker PRs and commits on top of master using
# REFERENCES:     This code reuses the excellent implementation of
#                 Docker in Docker made by Jerome Petazzoni.
#                 https://github.com/jpetazzo/dind
# COMMENTS:
#   This Dockerfile adapts /Dockerfile to enable docker PRs and commits testing
#   Optional arguments:
#       [commit]  (default: 'HEAD')
#       [repo]    (default: 'http://github.com/dotcloud/docker')
#       [branch]  (default: 'master')
# TO_BUILD:       docker build -t test_docker .
# TO_RUN:         docker run -privileged test_docker hack/dind test_docker.sh [commit] [repo] [branch]

# # Publish a release:
# docker run --privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

#

Author: Akihiro Suda <akihiro.suda.cz@hco.ntt.co.jp>
Comment:
# # Make a dockerd binary.
# # hack/make.sh binary
#
# # Install dockerd to /usr/local/bin
# # make install
#
# # Run unit tests
# # hack/test/unit
#
# # Run tests e.g. integration, py
# # hack/make.sh binary test-integration test-docker-py
#
# Note: AppArmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Akihiro Suda <akihiro.suda.cz@hco.ntt.co.jp>
Comment: # Just a little hack so we don't have to install these deps twice, once for runc and once for dockerd

Author: Akihiro Suda <akihiro.suda.cz@hco.ntt.co.jp>
Comment: # TODO: Some of this is only really needed for testing, it would be nice to split this up

Author: Akihiro Suda <akihiro.suda.cz@hco.ntt.co.jp>
Comment:
# TODO: This is for the docker-py tests, which shouldn't really be needed for
# this image, but currently CI is expecting to run this image. This should be

Author: Michael Crosby <michael@docker.com>
Comment:
# This file describes the standard way to build Docker, using docker
#
# Usage:
#
# # Assemble the full dev environment. This is slow the first time.
# docker build -t docker .
#
# # Mount your source in an interactive container for quick testing:
# docker run -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/dotcloud/docker -privileged -i -t docker bash
#
# # Run the test suite:
# docker run -privileged docker hack/make.sh test
#
# # Publish a release:
# docker run -privileged \
#  -e AWS_S3_BUCKET=baz \
#  -e AWS_ACCESS_KEY=foo \
#  -e AWS_SECRET_KEY=bar \
#  -e GPG_PASSPHRASE=gloubiboulga \
#  docker hack/release.sh
#
# Note: Apparmor used to mess with privileged mode, but this is no longer
# the case. Therefore, you don't have to disable it anymore.
#

Author: Michael Crosby <michael@docker.com>
Comment: # TODO add linux/386 and linux/arm
